data.question: The term “fudge factor” is best likened to which of the following terms?
data.instructionText: Select the light blue box to test your knowledge.

response.content:
Answer A is incorrect. Prioritization describes the action or process of deciding the relative importance or urgency of a thing or things. Fudge factor is best likened to rationalization, which is the action of attempting to explain or justify behavior with logical reasons, even when those reasons are not appropriate. In the case of a fudge factor, the rationalization relates to unethical behavior.

Answer B is correct. Fudge factor is best likened to rationalization. Rationalization is the action of attempting to explain or justify behavior with logical reasons, even when those reasons are not appropriate. In the case of a fudge factor, the rationalization relates to unethical behavior.

Answer C is incorrect. Comparison is the act of noting similarities or dissimilarities between items, people, or actions. In the case of a fudge factor, the rationalization relates to unethical behavior.

Answer D is incorrect. Judgment is the ability to make considered decisions or come to sensible conclusions. In the case of a fudge factor, the rationalization relates to unethical behavior.
